intro: Hermannia incana, commonly known as the silverleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Hermannia incana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
